title: How should we transcribe and punctuate filler words in full verbatim? - Quora

response.answer_text: You mean, uh, you’re talking about—hang on while I think about this—the apparently meaningless words, phrases, or sounds (thank you, Um, Is This, You Know, a Filler Word?) that, you know, mark pauses or hesitations in speech. For instance, like, okay— Punctuate as demonstrated above. Viz., predominantly with commas, but when longer between dashes or parentheses, and at the dangling ends of sentences with a dash or maybe an ellipsis … As for spelling, I suppose you could distinguish between uh, uhh, and uhhh, write um differently than mmm, sometimes or always transcribe y’know instead of you know in different people’s speech. It would depend on the purpose of your “full verbatim”: A deposition or other legal proceeding, versus a linguistic study, versus dialogue in a play or other fiction.
